newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Robbers kill Brazil soldier during police strike.
newsitem.headline: Robbers kill Brazil soldier during police strike.

text.p: A soldier was killed in a gunfight with bank robbers on Wednesday while patrolling the streets of Recife during a police strike in the northeast Brazilian state of Pernambuco, an official said.

"The soldier was patrolling with colleagues when they came across a bank robbery. There was a gunfight and he was shot in the neck," Pedro Francisco, spokesman for the public security office in Recife, the state capital, told Reuters.
The soldier was declared brain dead by doctors shortly after the gunfight, which erupted in the early afternoon. The bank robbers escaped in waiting cars.

Troops took to the streets of Recife on Monday to restore order after the police strike sparked a weekend of violent crime, with gangs of adolescent thieves rampaging through the city centre, robbing and assaulting at whim.
Pernambuco state, where police went on strike on July 16, is one of several plunged into chaos by police demands for better pay.
The army has been called in to protect government buildings in at least four of Brazil's 27 states. Last week, soldiers exchanged shots with striking police in Alagoas state.
A spokesman for the Army Ministry in Brasilia could provide no further information on Wednesday's shooting incident in Recife.
